paper_abstract: We prove that the problem of deciding whether a finite set of partial words is unavoidable is NP-hard for any alphabet of size larger than or equal to two, which is in contrast with the well-known feasability results for unavoidability of a set of full words. We raise some related questions on avoidability of sets of partial words. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Testing avoidability on sets of partial words is hard
